meanings.sent1: The cactus had a prick that could hurt you.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally sat on a prick from the rose bush.
meanings.sent3: The sewing needle's prick made me jump!
meanings.sent4: The prick of the thorn reminded me of life's little pains.
meanings.sent5: The prick of the pin left a tiny mark on my finger.

meanings.definition: To make a small hole in something
meanings.sent1: I used a needle to prick a hole in the paper.
meanings.sent2: She used a pin to prick the balloon and make it pop.
meanings.sent3: He tried to prick a hole in the tough fabric but failed.
meanings.sent4: The raindrops prick the soil, creating tiny puddles.
meanings.sent5: The chef used a fork to prick holes in the dough before baking.

meanings.sent1: The thorn can prick your finger if you touch it.
meanings.sent2: The bee's sting can prick and cause discomfort.
meanings.sent3: The icy wind can prick your skin and make you shiver.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to prick her heart, making her sad.
meanings.sent5: The sharp rock can prick your foot if you step on it.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a prick and interrupt others while they speak.
meanings.sent2: He can be a real prick when he's in a bad mood.
meanings.sent3: The prick at the store refused to help the customer.
meanings.sent4: She thought of him as a prick for his disrespectful behavior.
meanings.sent5: The boss's attitude made him come off as a prick to his employees.
